original: A list of top frequently asked  DB2 interview questions  and answers are given below.
result: Below is a compilation of commonly asked DB2 interview questions as well as their corresponding answers.

original: DB2 also known IBM Db2 is a relational database management system (RDBMS) product form IBM. It is designed to store, analyse and retrieve data efficiently.
result: DB2 is a popularly used Relational Database Management System (RDBMS) developed by IBM. It has been created to ensure efficient storage, analysis and retrieval of data.

original: Locking services are provided by Locking services component known as "Internal Resource Lock Manager" (IRLM) and manages concurrency issues and deadlocks.
result: IRLM is a component that offers locking services to handle concurrency problems and prevent deadlocks.

original: Locks can be classified based on size, duration and mode.
result: Locks can be categorized depending on their duration, size, and mode.

original: Locking can be applied on either of Page, table and table space.
result: Locking can be implemented at the level of pages, tables, or table spaces.

original: Three types of page locks can be held in DB2:
result: DB2 has the ability to support three different types of page locks.

original: COMMIT is used to change the data permanently by commits the database changes occur in the current transaction and made that changes permanent.
result: The COMMIT statement plays a crucial role in database management as it allows for permanent changes to be made to the data. When a COMMIT statement is executed, any changes made during the current transaction are saved and become a permanent part of the database.

original: The data types available in DB2 are:
result: DB2 offers various types of data that can be used when working with this database management system.

original: S9(4)COMP is the picture clause of a null indicator variable.
result: The picture clause S9(4)COMP is often used to represent a null indicator variable.

original: DB2 Optimizer is used to process the SQL statement.
result: The DB2 Optimizer is a tool utilized for executing SQL statements.

original: DB2 Optimizer can be used to enhance the performance of SQL.
result: One can use DB2 Optimizer to improve the efficiency of SQL and achieve better performance.

original: Database Services component is used to execute the SQL statement. It also manages buffer pool.
result: The Database Services component plays a crucial role in executing SQL statements and managing the buffer pool.

original: System Services component is responsible for handling DB2 startup and shutdown.
result: The component responsible for managing the startup and shutdown of DB2 is known as the System Services component.

original: SQLCA stands for Server Query Language Communication Area. Basically, it is a collection of variables that may be updated after the execution of every SQL statement.
result: SQLCA is an abbreviation for Server Query Language Communication Area which contains various variables that can be modified after running SQL statements.

original: A program having SQL executable statement can provide maximum one SQLCA whereas in Java it is not applicable.
result: A maximum of one SQLCA can be provided by a program with an executable SQL statement, which is not applicable in Java.

original: 136 is the maximum length of the SQLCA.
result: The SQLCA has a maximum length of 136 characters.

original: The following three are the fields from SQLCA:
result: Here are three examples of fields that can be found in SQLCA:

original: Check constraint is a database rule that checks data integrity. Thus, only values from the domain for the attribute or column are allowed.
result: A check constraint is a fundamental rule in a database system that's essential for maintaining data integrity. It restricts the range of values that can be entered into a column to only those that are appropriate for that particular field. As a result, only values that belong to the domain of the attribute can be accepted.

original: DB2 bind is process that prepares an access path to the data. This access path is stored as a package in the DB2 catalogue.
result: DB2 bind is a critical process that produces an access route to data. This access path is then saved as a package in the DB2 catalogue for later use.

original: DBRM stands for Database Request Module. It is a component inside DB2, which is created by the pre compiler of DB2. It contains SQL source statements that get extracted out of the application program. DBRMs form inputs that are helpful in the binding process.
result: DBRM is an essential part of DB2 that is generated by the pre-compiler of DB2. It contains SQL statements that are extracted from the application program and serves as inputs for the binding process. It is an acronym for Database Request Module.

original: Buffer pool is part of main memory space. This space is allotted by the database manager. It cache table and index data from the disk.
result: The buffer pool is a segment of the main memory area set aside by the database management system for data caching. It temporarily stores frequently accessed table and index data from the computer's disk for faster retrieval.

original: Data manager is a DB2 component that is responsible to manage physical database. It performs logging and locking by invoking other system components.
result: The data manager is a crucial element of DB2 that takes care of the management of the physical database. It is responsible for implementing the necessary locking and logging functionalities by calling on other system components to perform these tasks.

original: Storage group is a storage path where data can be stored. A table space can also be assigned to storage group.
result: A storage group refers to a specific location where data can be stored. Additionally, a table space can be associated with a storage group.

original: Predicates are used to enhance the performance of query.
result: Predicates play a vital role in optimizing queries.

original: The physical storage length of TIME data type is 3 bytes.
result: The TIME data type requires a physical storage length of 3 bytes.

original: The physical storage length of TIME data type is 4 bytes.
result: The TIME data type has a physical storage length of 4 bytes.

original: TIMESTAMP data type takes 10 bytes and default is YYYY-MM-DD: HH: MM:SS-NNNNNN
result: The TIMESTAMP data type requires 10 bytes of storage and is typically represented in the format of YYYY-MM-DD:HH:MM:SS-NNNNNN as the default.

original: The declaration generator provides an SQL Declare Table statement and language like COBOL, C data declaration for a particular table or view.
result: The tool called declaration generator generates a SQL "Declare Table" statement and also creates data declarations for tables or views in different programming languages such as COBOL or C.

original: The default page size of buffer pool is 4kb.
result: The buffer pool's default page size is set at 4kb.

original: DB2 optimizer is used to select the access paths and for processing SQL statements.
result: The DB2 optimizer functions to choose the most appropriate access paths and execute SQL statements in processing databases.

original: Concurrency is the process in which more than one application can access the similar data at same time.
result: Concurrency is the ability for multiple applications to access the same data simultaneously.

original: Uncommitted read provides maximum concurrency.
result: The uncommitted read approach facilitates the highest degree of concurrency.

original: Repeatable Read provides highest data integrity as it holds page and lock the rows until a COMMIT point.
result: The Repeatable Read isolation level ensures optimum data integrity by retaining the page and locking the rows until the COMMIT point is reached.

original: Resource Control Table (RCT) is controller that directs the CICS DB2 interface. Using DSNCRCT, RCT can produce a micro table.
result: The Resource Control Table (RCT) is a controller that manages the interactions between CICS and DB2. It is possible to create a micro table using DSNCRCT with RCT.

original: DB2 performs auto rollback when a program is aborted in the middle of some transaction.
result: In the event that a program is terminated during a transaction, DB2 will conduct an automatic rollback.

original: A cursor can be declared either in Working Storage Section or in Procedure Division also.
result: It is possible to declare a cursor in either the Working Storage Section or the Procedure Division.

original: The maximum size of a CHAR data type in DB2 is 254 bytes.
result: The maximum length of the CHAR data type that can be stored in DB2 is 254 bytes.

original: The maximum size of a VARCHAR data type in DB2 is 4046 bytes.
result: In DB2, the VARCHAR data type has a maximum capacity of 4046 bytes.

original: SPUFI stands for SQL Processor Using File Input.
result: SPUFI is an acronym that stands for SQL Processor Using File Input.

original: In DB2, a role is an object of database that group various privileges together and can be assigned to groups or user by GRANT statement.
result: A role is a database object in DB2 that combines multiple privileges and can be granted to users or groups through the use of GRANT statements. It allows for greater flexibility in managing user access and permissions.

original: Cursor stability ensures that any row that has been changed by activation group with a dissimilar commitment definition cannot be read before committing.
result: The concept of cursor stability refers to the ability to prevent the reading of rows that have been altered by an activation group with a different commitment definition until they have been committed.

original: There are three reasons for not using SELECT * in embedded SQL programs:
result: There are three factors that make using SELECT * in embedded SQL programs not recommended.

original: If you change the table structure i.e. adding a field, the program will have to be modified.
result: Modifying the table structure by including an additional field will require making changes to the program.

original: Program can retrieve the columns which it might not use, leading an I/O overhead.
result: The program may retrieve columns that are not necessary, causing unnecessary I/O overhead.

original: The chance of an index only scan is lost.
result: The opportunity for an index-only scan is missed.

original: If you use the OPEN CURSOR command with ORDER BY clause, the rows are fetched, sorted and made available for the FETCH statement. Otherwise simply the cursor is placed on the first row.
result: When you utilize the OPEN CURSOR instruction along with an ORDER BY clause, the rows are sorted and retrieved in a particular order for use in the FETCH statement. In cases where no ORDER BY clause exists, the cursor is simply positioned on the first row of data.

original: DCLGEN is stands for DeCLarations GENErator. It is used to create the host language copy books for the table definitions. It also creates the DECLARE table.
result: DCLGEN is an acronym for DeCLarations GENErator. It serves as a tool for generating host language copy books for table definitions along with the creation of the DECLARE table.

original: EXEC SQL DECLARE TABLE statement which gives the layout of the table in terms of DB2 data type.
result: The DECLARE TABLE statement in EXEC SQL provides information about the structure of a table in terms of the data types used in DB2.

original: A host language copy book that gives the host variable definitions for the column name.
result: A workbook containing definitions for host variables corresponding to each column name.
